metadata.title: 5233-1 -- ClamAV vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled memory when the CL_SCAN_GENERAL_COLLECT_METADATA scan option was enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5233-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libclamav-dev - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-testfiles - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-base - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-daemon - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-milter - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-docs - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-freshclam - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 libclamav9 - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamdscan - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 No subscription required
